attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The commuter service between Kent and London Cannon St via Medway towns currently carries 4882 commuters per day into London Cannon St.  

Under the proposals resulting from the Integrated Kent Franchise, only 30% of the service will run - 2 trains per rush hour instead of 7.  The service into Cannon St from 2009 will only be able to take 1420.  The remaining 3462 will have to go via St Pancras.  Rail fares will increase across the board,  Those having to travel via St Pancras will have to pay even more for tube travel.  

We can do nothing, or we can campaign.  

SouthEastern Rail are beyond reason, their only concern is increasing their massive profits at the expense of the commuters and taxpayers.  

The government may do little.  Or they may have enough grasp of maths to subtract 3462 votes from Labour’s majority in some of the local constituencies.  Medway’s Labour majority was a mere 213, Thanet South’s only 664.  A shortfall of some 2,700 votes is not to be ignored.  

Please sign this petition.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "reconsider the extreme reduction of the Broadstairs - Medway towns - London Cannon Street service as a result of the Integrated Kent Franchise (due for introduction in 2009) which will result in over 70% of the current service being diverted to St Pancras, whilst increasing the fare and the journey time for the thousands of Cannon Street commuters."
